name: Corvus Robotics
headline: Autonomous drones to help warehouses scan inventory.
description: Our software allows drones to fly indoors and collect analytics, helping warehouses automate inventory collection.
tags: industry:warehouse-management-tech; industry:robotics; industry:drones; industry:logistics; industry:supply-chain; location:san-francisco-bay-area

founders.name: Jonathan Sandau, Founder/Chief Software Architect
founders.description: Chief Software Architect at Corvus Robotics (S18)

generated_description:
Corvus Robotics, founded in 2017 and a proud Y Combinator Batch S18 participant, is making strides in the realm of warehouse automation with their innovative approach to inventory management. Based in Mountain View, California, and sporting a tight-knit team of 20, Corvus is on a mission to revolutionize how warehouses operate by harnessing the power of autonomous drones.

Their flagship product, the Corvus One, is designed to fly around warehouse facilities autonomously, scanning pallet labels with precision, and collecting real-time data. This means no human involvement during inventory checks, dramatically reducing labor costs and boosting efficiency—a game-changer for businesses dealing with the challenges of inventory management. 

In essence, Corvus Robotics is tackling some of the primary pain points in logistics and supply chain operations by providing robust drone solutions tailored for various industries including 3PL, manufacturing, retail, and accounting. Their technology allows companies to perform cycle counts daily, improving accuracy and responsiveness, which is particularly crucial in today's market where labor shortages are prevalent.

They’ve got a clear understanding of their value proposition: by automating inventory processes, businesses can save on warehouse leases, minimize human error, and ultimately enhance their bidding capacities in a competitive landscape. 

For those interested in this cutting-edge technology or looking to learn more, check out their website at [Corvus Robotics](https://www.corvus-robotics.com). Whether you’re a logistics professional or simply curious about where the future of warehouse management is headed, Corvus Robotics is a company to watch closely as they lead the way into an automated future.
